target: Independent AI safety auditors reviewing model behavior for organizations
urgency: CRITICAL — regulations incoming, no standard proof of audit thoroughness
trust_problem: Companies hiring auditors can't verify the audit was actually thorough
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Entire field is new — becoming THE credential for AI auditors means owning the category
public_data_source: AI safety org directories + published audit reports + X posts
signal_to_find_them: "AI safety audit" OR "red teaming LLMs" on X/LinkedIn + conference speaker lists
outreach_angle: You're building a new profession — screen history becomes the audit trail that regulators will eventually require

target: Talented developers who failed Toptal's screening but are demonstrably skilled
urgency: HIGH — rejected from elite platform and need alternative credibility signal
trust_problem: Failed a gatekeeping test that doesn't measure real-world engineering
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Toptal rejects are a defined angry cohort — screen history is their bypass
public_data_source: Reddit r/freelance + X posts, Blind posts
signal_to_find_them: "failed Toptal" OR "Toptal rejection" OR "Toptal screening" on Reddit/X/Blind
outreach_angle: You passed the real test — building actual software. Here's proof that matters more than a timed algorithm quiz

target: Web3 contributors submitting work proofs to DAOs for bounty/retroactive funding
urgency: HIGH — money is directly at stake and disputes are common
trust_problem: DAOs have no way to verify contributor claims about hours or effort
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Small enough community that word-of-mouth can reach everyone through Discord/governance forums
public_data_source: Snapshot governance + Coordinape circles + DAO Discord servers
signal_to_find_them: Active voters on Snapshot + Coordinape contributors + "DAO bounty" posts on X
outreach_angle: Stop arguing about whether you did the work — screen history is your receipt

target: Tech professionals who serve as expert witnesses in IP/patent/trade secret litigation
urgency: CRITICAL — court outcomes depend on proving methodology, fees are $500-1500/hr
trust_problem: Courts need to trust that expert's analysis was rigorous and unbiased
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Tiny profession where becoming standard practice means every expert needs it
public_data_source: Expert witness directories (SEAK + ALM + JurisPro) + court filing databases
signal_to_find_them: Expert witness registries filtered to technology/software + PACER patent case filings
outreach_angle: Your analysis is worth $1000/hr — screen history makes it bulletproof in court

target: Smart contract security auditors who review DeFi protocols before launch
urgency: CRITICAL — $billions at stake, one missed bug = catastrophic exploit
trust_problem: Protocols paying $50-500K for audits can't verify auditor thoroughness
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Entire community fits in a few Telegram groups — capture it and you own Web3 security trust
public_data_source: Code4rena + Sherlock leaderboards + Immunefi bug bounty profiles
signal_to_find_them: Code4rena/Sherlock wardens + "smart contract audit" on X + GitHub Solidity security repos
outreach_angle: When a $100M protocol gets hacked after your audit you want proof you were thorough

target: Solo open source maintainers trying to get paid for maintenance work
urgency: HIGH — burnout crisis and sponsors want proof of ongoing effort
trust_problem: Sponsors can see commits but not the invisible maintenance work (triaging/reviewing/debugging)
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: GitHub Sponsors is a defined population with public profiles — reachable in one campaign
public_data_source: GitHub Sponsors profiles + Open Collective + thanks.dev
signal_to_find_them: GitHub Sponsors profiles with <$500/mo funding + repos with 1K+ stars + "open source sustainability" posts
outreach_angle: Your commit graph shows 10% of your work — screen history shows sponsors the other 90%

niche: Immigration O-1 Visa Applicants in Tech
target: Tech workers applying for O-1 extraordinary ability visa needing evidence portfolio
urgency: CRITICAL — visa outcome determines whether they can stay in the US, process costs $10-20K
trust_problem: Need to prove ""extraordinary ability"" with tangible evidence beyond recommendation letters
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Small annual cohort and immigration lawyers are the gatekeepers — get 5 lawyers to recommend you
public_data_source: Immigration lawyer directories + O-1 discussion communities
signal_to_find_them: r/immigration + Blind visa threads + "O-1 visa" on X + immigration lawyer client testimonials
outreach_angle: USCIS wants evidence of extraordinary ability — continuous screen history of your technical work is exactly that

target: Independent fractional CTOs serving 2-4 startups simultaneously
urgency: HIGH — clients paying $10-20K/mo worry about split attention and actual hours
trust_problem: Startups can't verify their fractional CTO is actually spending contracted time
how_screen_history_captures_entire_marke: Small enough that 3-4 LinkedIn posts from happy users would reach the whole community

signal_to_find_them: LinkedIn profiles with "fractional CTO" + TopCTO + CTO.ai directories + Lemon.io
outreach_angle: Your clients are paying $15K/month and wondering if you're actually working on their stuff — screen history ends that doubt

target: Speedrunners submitting runs for leaderboard verification where video proof is required
urgency: MEDIUM-HIGH — community reputation depends on verified legitimate runs
trust_problem: Tool-assisted runs and spliced videos make verification increasingly difficult

signal_to_find_them: Top 100 runners per major game on speedrun.com + "WR" or "PB" posts on X/Reddit with video links
outreach_angle: Full screen history makes run verification instant — no more suspicion about spliced videos

target: Regulatory consultants helping medical device companies with FDA UDI compliance documentation
urgency: CRITICAL — FDA compliance, $millions at stake if documentation is questioned

outreach_angle: When FDA audits your client's documentation process you want timestamped proof of every step

target: Elite Kaggle competitors (Grandmaster rank) who are actively seeking employment

target: Forensic examiners doing court-ordered device analysis in criminal/civil cases
